org.gearvrf

Class GVRJavaComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRJavaComponent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRLightBase, GVRRenderData

    public class GVRJavaComponent
extends GVRComponent
    Base class for defining Java components to extend the scene object. Java components are used to add Java behaviours to scene objects that can be initiated by the rendering thread. A GVRJavaComponent keeps a reference to the Java object in the C++ layer so that functions on the object can be invoked during rendering.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRJavaComponent

        protected GVRJavaComponent(GVRContext gvrContext,
                           long nativePointer)
        Constructor for a component that is not attached to a scene object.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The current GVRF context
        nativePointer - Pointer to the native object, returned by the native constructor

      • GVRJavaComponent

        protected GVRJavaComponent(GVRContext gvrContext,
                           long nativePointer,
                           java.util.List<GVRHybridObject.NativeCleanupHandler> cleanupHandlers)
        Special constructor, for descendants like that need to 'unregister' instances.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The current GVRF context
        nativePointer - The native pointer, returned by the native constructor
        cleanupHandlers - Cleanup handler(s). Normally, this will be a private static class constant, so that there is only one List per class. Descendants that supply a List and also have descendants that supply a List should use CleanupHandlerListManager to maintain a Map<List<NativeCleanupHandler>, List<NativeCleanupHandler>> whose keys are descendant lists and whose values are unique concatenated lists - see GVRCollider for an example.
